ALLEGATION:
On 09/23/21, Youth tried to get in a fight with his peer; youth pushed against a
supervisor, which led to him being restrained. During the restraint, youth claimed
that he was being sexually assaulted because staff had him bent over. Youth also
said that CPS told him that he is not allowed to be restrained. Youth was not injured
during this restraint.
2

INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Administrator 1 by phone on 9/23/2021. He reported being the staff
that reported the restraint because of the statement Youth A made about being
sexually assaulted. He reported Youth A entered the school classroom wanting to
fight with a peer because he was upset over information provided by his Probation
Officer. He reported another youth was ready to fight when staff intervened and had
Youth A leave the room. He also reported the restraint was initiated by him and Staff
1 after Youth A aggressively pushed Supervisor 1. He reported they placed Youth A
into a “Team Control” restraint. He described this hold as staff on either side of
Youth A with a hand on the shoulder while holding Youth A’s arm. Further
description indicated that their inner leg is placed in front of Youth A’s legs and
Youth A is bent at the waist. He reported bending Youth A was part of the procedure
of the restraint and provides better support to keep anyone from falling when there is
resistance. Youth A calmed down after approximately five minutes and was released
from the hold. He reported Youth A said he was being sexually assaulted. Youth A
told him he was being sexually assaulted because they had him bent over.
Administrator 1 denied any staff touched Youth A in “his private area” during the
incident and he provided the names of the other staff present during the restraint. He
also provided the name of Youth B who “may have witnessed the restraint”.
I interviewed Administrator 1 at the facility on 9/24/2021. He gave the same
information and added that he attempted to avoid restraints as much as possible but
viewed Youth A’s behavior as aggressive towards staff. He also reported Youth A’s
actions caused an unsafe situation resulting in the need for a restraint.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the facility on 9/24/2021. She reported being
present in the school when she received a “call for assistance at the school”. She
also reported arriving on the scene when Youth A was in the “refocus room”. She
reported Youth A was yelling about “beating someone up and saying he was going
to tear up everything”. She also reported Administrator 1, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3
where already in the room trying to verbally deescalate Youth A, so she stood in the
doorway. She reported having Youth B with her because he came with her from the
kitchen area. She reported Youth A pushed her when Administrator 1 and Staff 1
placed him in a “Team Control” position. She gave the same description of the hold
as other staff and denied that anyone touched Youth A inappropriately. She also
reported Youth A said he was being sexually molested but didn’t recall his response
when asked how.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 9/24/2021. He reported being in the
“dining hall” with Supervisor 1 when he received an assistance call to the classroom.
He reported seeing Youth A who he described as “tripping” pushing Supervisor 1
before being placed in a restraint. He reported staff were talking to Youth A in an
attempt to deescalate him. He was shown a picture of the “Team Control” position
and said, “it was just like that”. He reported seeing nothing inappropriate with the
restraint. He ended when he reported feeling safe at the facility and having his
needs met by staff and the program
3

I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 9/24/2021. He denied that he was sexually
molested and stated, “they made me bend over and it made me feel uncomfortable”.
He also denied that anyone touched him inappropriately during the restraint. He
denied trying to push Supervisor 1 and reported he just tried to walk out of the room.
He reported going into the classroom upset and wanting to fight someone because
he was upset because his Probation Officer “was trying to blame me for stuff”. He
also reported, “I just said who wants to fight and another youth stood up. I squared
up and he flinched. He tried to swing but I punched him.” He ended when he
reported the restraint lasted twenty minutes.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 9/24/2021. He reported the incident,
matching what other staff reported. He reported the restraint was initiated after
Youth A pushed Supervisor 1 and he was placed in a “Team Control”. He described
the “Team Control” as pictured in the information provided by the facility and
described by other staff. He reported hearing Youth A say he was sexually molested
and when asked how, having Youth A report it was because he was bent over. He
also reported the restraint was appropriate in all aspects. He ended when he
reported spending forty-five minutes after the restraint talking with Youth A to help
him process the incident.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 9/24/2021. He gave the same account of the
incident as other staff present. He reported being in the classroom when Youth A
attempted to fight other youth and going to the refocus room with him. He reported
the restraint was initiated when Youth A pushed against Supervisor 1 and the
restraint was appropriate. He described the restraint as the “Team Control”. He
never observed any sexual abuse by staff.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 9/24/2021. He reported the incident
occurring in the same way as other staff reported the incident. Additionally, he
reported Youth A punched another youth before being removed to the refocus room.
He reported the restraint was initiated because staff believed Youth A may harm
someone else after pushing Supervisor 1. He denied any sexual touching by staff
during the restraint. He ended when he reported the restraint was appropriate.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
I reviewed the personnel files for Administrator 1 and Staff 1. They are up to date on
training and have no documentation of any disciplinary action.
I reviewed the Residential Initial Treatment Plan for Youth A. This document is dated
7/7/21 and covers a period of 6/9/21 to 7/7/21. Goals identified include learning to
cope with his emotions in a safe and productive manner under the Emotional
Stability Behavior domain. Development of independent living skills under the
Housing and life skills domain. A goal of understanding consequences relative to
negative behavior patterns under the Peer/Adult social relationships domain. A goal
of developing a lifestyle free of substance abuse under the substance abuse
4

domain. A goal of understanding aspects of his life that have made him feel
victimized under the victimization domain. Each of the goals has appropriate desired
outcomes, action steps and services provided to address the needs.
I reviewed the behavior management policy/procedure. This document states “Any
physical behavior management intervention will be used as a last resort and after
nonphysical techniques are exhausted. To promote safety a team approach (two or
more staff) is the expected practice when intervening with acting out students.”
I reviewed the “Safety-Interventions – High-Level Holding in a standing position
Team Control Position”. This document has a picture of the hold described by staff
and Youth A and matches their description. The “control dynamics” are described as
Managing the arms to reduce upper-body strength, managing the incline to reduce
lower-body strength and managing mobility through close body contract.
I reviewed the incident report of the restraint that occurred on 9/23/2021. This
document identified the staff involved and Youth A as taking part in the restraint. The
restraint and events leading up to it are described just as staff and Youth A
described the incident. There is documentation that the restraint lasted
approximately five minutes and occurred at 9:40 AM. It is also documented that no
medical follow-up was needed.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
5

ANALYSIS: Evidence provided through interviews and written
documentation do not support the allegations of staff
mishandling Youth A during the restraint or engaging in sexual
abuse of Youth A. Evidence suggests Youth A was very upset
and engaged in aggressive behaviors, thus the restraint was
initiated in a safe manner. Youth A also reported he was just
feeling uncomfortable rather than being sexually molested.
Technical Assistance:
It was suggested to the facility that a system of support is
developed to help youth deal with possible negative news they
may receive from their workers or other outside contacts. This
process could involve having a staff they are comfortable talking
with or their therapist available following these contacts. The
facility reported having several different systems in place at this
time.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
It is recommended that this investigation be closed with no change made to the
license of this Child Caring Institution
